text: @eid_294ba09d created this channel on 2026-08-15 13:53:00. This is the very beginning of the bug-alicemartinez-FlowForce channel.
@eid_294ba09d joined bug-alicemartinez-FlowForce. Also, @eid_b6268ef7, @eid_d098d618, @eid_ba9224d2, @eid_fc0f17c3, @eid_d0d918f1 joined via invite.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with FlowForce that need our attention. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have an issue titled 'Inaccurate Latency Prediction Model'. The AI Model & Analysis Engine is providing inaccurate latency estimates, which could lead users to make unnecessary optimizations. This is impacting customer CUST-0014. @eid_ba9224d2, this one's for you.
Got it! I'll dive into the AI Model & Analysis Engine to see what's causing the inaccuracies. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have a security issue: 'Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Flow Management Interface'. This is a significant risk as it could lead to data breaches. It's affecting the Security & Authentication Module and customer CUST-0082. @eid_d098d618, can you take this one?
Absolutely, I'll prioritize this and start working on a fix to secure the Flow Management Interface. Security is key! üîí

Thanks, @eid_d098d618! Lastly, we have 'Misclassification of API Endpoint Performance'. Similar to the first issue, it's affecting the AI Model & Analysis Engine and leading to misguided optimization efforts. This is impacting customer CUST-0077. @eid_ba9224d2, this one's also for you.
No problem, I'll handle this one too. I'll make sure to address the anomaly in the feature extraction process. üöÄ
Awesome, thanks for jumping on these so quickly, team! If you need any more details or support, just let me know. Let's get these resolved and keep our customers happy! üòä
Will do! Thanks for coordinating, @eid_294ba09d. Let's keep the momentum going! üí™
Thanks, everyone! I'll keep you posted on my progress. Let's optimize those flows! üåü
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current issues. Let's take a look at them! üòä

First, we have a bug in TensorFlow titled 'Inaccurate Model Prediction for Time-Series Data'. The model is giving incorrect predictions, which is similar to our 'Inaccurate Latency Prediction Model' issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/1501. @eid_ba9224d2, this might give us some insights into our AI Model & Analysis Engine problem.
Thanks, Alice! I'll check out the TensorFlow PR. It could definitely help us refine our approach to fixing the latency prediction inaccuracies. üöÄ

Next up, there's a security issue in WordPress: 'Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability in Admin Dashboard'. This is quite similar to our XSS issue in the Flow Management Interface. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/pull/1502. Ian, this might be useful for your work on securing our interface.
Great find, Alice! I'll review the WordPress PR to see how they tackled the XSS vulnerability. It might offer some valuable strategies for our security patch. üîí

Lastly, there's a bug in Apache Kafka titled 'Misclassification of Consumer Lag Metrics'. It sounds a lot like our 'Misclassification of API Endpoint Performance' issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1503. Alice Taylor, this could be relevant for your work on the AI Model & Analysis Engine.
I'll definitely look into the Kafka PR. Understanding how they addressed the misclassification could help us improve our feature extraction process. Thanks for sharing, Alice! üåü
Awesome, team! Let's leverage these insights to enhance our solutions. If you need any more details or support, just let me know. Let's keep our momentum going and make our customers happy! üòä
Will do, Alice! Thanks for coordinating and finding these resources. Let's get to work! üí™
Thanks, everyone! I'll keep you posted on my progress with the TensorFlow and Kafka insights. Let's optimize those flows! üöÄ
Hi team, the bug about incorrect latency predictions in FlowForce has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/30.
The root cause was an outdated model that hadn't been retrained with recent data, leading to inaccurate predictions and unnecessary optimization suggestions.
To fix this, I updated the model with the latest dataset and implemented a scheduled retraining process to ensure it stays current. This should prevent similar issues in the future.
Great work, @eid_ba9224d2! Thanks for getting this sorted out so quickly.
Thanks, Alice Taylor! The scheduled retraining sounds like a solid solution. Let me know if you need any help with monitoring the model's performance.
Thanks, @eid_d098d618! I'll keep you posted if anything comes up. Appreciate the support, everyone!
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with FlowForce that need our immediate attention. Let's go through them one by one. üöÄ

First up, we have a 'Database Sync Error Leads to Inconsistent Flow Data'. This is affecting the Database & Data Synchronization Module. The impact is significant as users might make decisions based on inaccurate data, which could disrupt service delivery. Customer ID: CUST-0071. @eid_d0d918f1, this one's for you.
Got it! I'll dive into the database sync issue and ensure we get accurate flow metrics back on track. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have an 'Inefficient Data Transformation Process'. This is slowing down API response times, impacting the Performance Optimization & Routing Logic. Customer ID: CUST-0100. @eid_d098d618, can you take this one?
Sure thing! I'll optimize the data transformation process to improve those response times. Let's get those APIs running smoothly again! üöÄ

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, there's a 'Security Vulnerability in API Flow Authentication'. This is a critical issue as it poses a security risk, potentially leading to data breaches. Affected area is the Security & Authentication Module. Customer ID: CUST-0022. @eid_fc0f17c3, can you handle this?
Absolutely, I'll prioritize this security vulnerability and ensure our API flows are secure. Thanks for flagging this! üîí
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep communication open as you work through these issues. Feel free to reach out if you need any additional resources or support. üôå
Will do! I'll update once I have more info on the sync issue. üìä
Same here, I'll keep you posted on the data transformation improvements. üöÄ
I'll share updates on the security fix as soon as possible. üîê
Perfect, thanks again, team! Let's get these resolved for our customers. üí™
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that mirror the issues we're tackling in Salesforce. Let's take a look and see if we can draw any insights from them! üöÄ

First up, we have a 'Data Sync Error in Replication' in PostgreSQL. This issue is about replication lag causing inconsistent data across nodes, which could lead to data integrity problems. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/postgres/postgres/pull/1525. @eid_d0d918f1, this seems similar to the database sync error you're working on. Thoughts?

Thanks, Alice! This is definitely relevant. The replication lag issue in PostgreSQL could provide insights into how we handle sync errors in our Database & Data Synchronization Module. I'll review the PR and see if there are any strategies we can adopt. üëç

Great, Charlie! Next, there's an 'Inefficient Message Transformation' issue in Apache Kafka. The slow transformation process is increasing latency in message delivery, affecting real-time processing. Check out the PR here: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1526. Ian, this might be useful for the data transformation process you're optimizing.

Absolutely, Alice! The Kafka issue is quite similar to our API response time problem. I'll dive into the PR to see how they tackled the inefficiencies. It might give us some fresh ideas for improving our Performance Optimization & Routing Logic. üöÄ

Awesome, Ian! Lastly, there's a 'Security Flaw in Token Validation' in OAuth2 Proxy. This flaw could allow unauthorized access, posing a significant security risk. Here's the PR: https://github.com/oauth2-proxy/oauth2-proxy/pull/1527. Fiona, this seems directly related to the security vulnerability you're addressing.

Thanks, Alice! This is spot on. The token validation issue in OAuth2 Proxy could provide valuable insights into strengthening our API Flow Authentication. I'll review their approach and see how we can enhance our Security & Authentication Module. üîí

Perfect, team! Let's keep these open-source solutions in mind as we work through our internal issues. Feel free to reach out if you need any additional resources or support. Let's get these resolved for our customers! üí™
Will do, Alice! I'll update once I have more info on the sync issue. üìä
Same here, I'll keep you posted on the data transformation improvements. üöÄ
I'll share updates on the security fix as soon as possible. üîê
Hi team, the bug titled 'Security Vulnerability in API Flow Authentication' has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/41.
The root cause was improper validation of authentication tokens in the API flow management module, which allowed unauthorized access to API flows.
To fix this, I implemented a stricter validation process for authentication tokens, ensuring they are verified against a secure token registry before granting access to any API flows.
Great work, @eid_fc0f17c3! This was a critical issue, and I'm glad it's resolved. Thanks for the quick turnaround.
Thanks, Fiona! This fix will definitely enhance our security posture. I'll update the documentation to reflect these changes.
Nice job, Fiona. Do we need to run any additional tests to ensure everything is working as expected?
@eid_d098d618, yes, I've already run the initial tests, but it would be great if the QA team could perform a thorough regression test to confirm everything is stable.
Got it, I'll coordinate with QA to get that scheduled. Thanks again, Fiona!
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with the FlowForce feature. Let's go through them and assign accordingly. üòä

First up, we have an issue titled 'API Flow Analysis Incorrectly Identifies Bottlenecks'. The AI Model & Analysis Engine is inaccurately flagging certain API endpoints as bottlenecks, which could lead to unnecessary optimizations. This is impacting customer CUST-0029. @eid_d0d918f1, can you take this one?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the AI Model & Analysis Engine and see what's causing the false positives. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have a 'Suboptimal Load Balancing Algorithm' issue. The load balancing isn't distributing API requests evenly, causing some servers to overload. This is affecting customer CUST-0038. @eid_d098d618, can you handle this?
Got it! I'll check the Performance Optimization & Routing Logic to ensure requests are balanced properly. Let's get those servers running smoothly again! üöÄ

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, there's an 'Inaccurate Data Representation in Charts' issue. The dashboard charts are showing incorrect data points, which is frustrating for users and impacting customer CUST-0041. @eid_b6268ef7, can you look into this?
Absolutely, I'll review the User Interface & Data Visualization Module to correct those charts. We can't have misleading visuals! üìä
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep communication open as you work through these. Feel free to reach out if you need any more info or assistance. üôå
Will do! I'll update once I have more insights. üõ†Ô∏è
Same here, I'll keep you posted on the progress. üí™
Thanks, I'll make sure to share updates as I work through the issue. üòä
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might give us insights into our current issues. Let's take a look and see how they tackled similar problems. üòä

First up, we have an issue from TensorFlow titled 'Incorrect Model Bottleneck Identification'. Their model analysis tool is incorrectly flagging certain layers as bottlenecks, similar to our API Flow Analysis issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/1529. @eid_d0d918f1, what do you think?
Thanks, Alice! This is quite similar to what we're seeing with our AI Model & Analysis Engine. I'll review their approach and see if we can apply any of their solutions to our problem. üõ†Ô∏è

Great! Next, there's a Kubernetes issue titled 'Uneven Pod Distribution Across Nodes'. Their load balancing mechanism isn't distributing pods evenly, which is causing node overloads. Sounds familiar, right? Here's the PR: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/1530. Ian, any thoughts?

Absolutely, Alice! This mirrors our load balancing issue. I'll dive into their PR to see how they addressed the distribution logic. It might give us some good pointers for our Performance Optimization & Routing Logic. üöÄ

Awesome, Ian! Lastly, we have a Grafana issue titled 'Misleading Data Points in Graph Panels'. Their graph panels are showing incorrect data points, which is similar to our dashboard charts issue. Check out the PR here: https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/1531. Charlie Taylor, could you take a look?
Sure thing, Alice! This is definitely relevant to our User Interface & Data Visualization Module. I'll review their fix and see if we can adapt any of their strategies to correct our charts. üìä
Thanks, everyone! Let's keep these open-source solutions in mind as we work through our issues. Feel free to share any insights or ideas you gather from these PRs. üôå
Will do, Alice! I'll update the team once I have more insights from the TensorFlow PR. üëç
Same here, I'll keep you all posted on any relevant findings from the Kubernetes PR. üí™
Thanks, Alice! I'll make sure to share any useful strategies from the Grafana PR as I work through our issue. üòä
Hi team, the bug titled 'Inefficient Data Transformation Process' has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/42.

The root cause was identified as a non-optimized algorithm in the transformation logic, which was increasing computational overhead and slowing down processing times for API requests that required data format conversions.

To resolve this, I refactored the algorithm to use a more efficient approach that reduces the number of operations needed for data transformation. This should significantly improve the processing speed.
Great work, @eid_d098d618! Thanks for tackling this so quickly. Have you noticed any improvements in the processing times after the fix?
Yes, @Fiona Brown, after implementing the changes, the processing times have improved by approximately 40%. This should help with the delays we were experiencing.
That's fantastic news, Ian! Thanks for the update. I'll inform the QA team to run some tests to ensure everything is working smoothly.
Thanks, Ian! This should make a big difference for our API performance. Let me know if you need any help with further testing or deployment.
Thanks, @Alice Martinez and @Charlie Miller. I'll keep you posted if anything comes up during testing. Appreciate the support!
Hi team, the bug about incorrect data representation in charts on the FlowForce dashboard has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/43.
The root cause was a mismatch in data type handling between our data processing backend and the visualization library. This caused the charts to display incorrect data points.
To fix it, I updated the data processing logic to ensure consistent data types are used before passing data to the visualization library. This ensures accurate plotting of data points.
Great work, @eid_b6268ef7! This was a critical issue, and I'm glad it's resolved. Thanks for the quick turnaround.
Thanks, Charlie Taylor! This should help prevent any misleading interpretations of our data. I'll inform the stakeholders about the fix.
Nice job, @eid_b6268ef7. I'll run some tests on the dashboard to ensure everything is working as expected.
Thanks, everyone! Let me know if you encounter any more issues. I'll be around to help.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with FlowForce that need our attention. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have an issue titled 'Latency Reduction Feature Causes Increased API Response Time'. The latency reduction feature is actually increasing response times for some API calls. This is affecting the Performance Optimization & Routing Logic area and impacting customer CUST-0038. @eid_d098d618, can you take this one?
Got it, I'll look into the latency issue and see what's causing the increased response times. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have a UI issue: 'UI Freezes During High-Volume Data Visualization'. When users visualize large datasets, the dashboard becomes unresponsive. This affects the User Interface & Data Visualization Module and impacts customer CUST-0048. @eid_d098d618, this one's also for you.
Alright, I'll handle the UI freeze issue as well. I'll start by checking the data visualization module for any bottlenecks. üöÄ

Thanks, @eid_d098d618! Lastly, we have 'Unresponsive UI Elements During Data Drill-Down'. Users can't interact with specific data points for detailed analysis, which is frustrating for them. This is also in the User Interface & Data Visualization Module, impacting customer CUST-0102. @eid_b6268ef7, can you take this one?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the drill-down issue and see what's causing the UI elements to become unresponsive. Let's get this sorted for CUST-0102! üí™
Awesome, thanks everyone for jumping on these issues so quickly. Let's keep the customers happy! If you need any more info or help, just shout. üôå
Will do! Thanks for organizing everything. üòä
Thanks, I'll keep you posted on my progress. üëç
Hi team, I've found some interesting open-source bugs that might help us with our current Salesforce issues. Let's take a look at them! üòä

First up, we have a bug in Kibana titled 'Increased Latency in Dashboard Queries'. It seems their new query optimization feature is causing increased response times, similar to our latency issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/elastic/kibana/pull/1533. @Ian Miller, could you check this out and see if there are any insights we can apply to our situation?
Sure, Alice! I'll review the Kibana PR and see if their approach to handling increased latency can help us with our FlowForce issue. üëç

Great, thanks Ian! Next, there's a Grafana issue titled 'UI Freezes with Large Data Sets'. This sounds a lot like our UI freeze problem. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/1534. Ian, since you're already looking into our UI issue, could you also take a look at this one?
Absolutely, Alice. I'll dive into the Grafana PR and see if their solution can help us improve our data visualization module. üöÄ

Thanks, Ian! Lastly, there's a Metabase bug titled 'Unresponsive Drill-Down in Data Visualizations'. This is very similar to the drill-down issue we're facing. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/1535. Charlie, could you take a look at this one and see if there's anything we can learn?
On it, Alice! I'll review the Metabase PR and see if their approach to fixing unresponsive drill-downs can be applied to our issue. üí™
Awesome, thanks everyone for jumping on these so quickly. Let's see if these open-source projects can give us some fresh ideas. If you need any more info or help, just shout. üôå
Will do! Thanks for organizing everything, Alice. üòä
Thanks, Alice! I'll keep you posted on my progress with the Metabase issue. üëç
Hi team, the bug about incorrect bottleneck identification in the FlowForce feature has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/44.
The root cause was an error in the machine learning model's training data. It included mislabeled examples of bottlenecks, which led to inaccurate flagging of API endpoints.

To fix this, we retrained the model with a corrected dataset and implemented additional validation checks to ensure the accuracy of bottleneck identification. This should prevent similar issues in the future.
Great work, Charlie Miller! Thanks for the update. I'll review the PR shortly.
Thanks, @eid_d0d918f1. It's good to know the root cause was addressed. Do we need to inform the users about this fix?
Yes, @eid_d098d618, a notification to the users would be helpful. We should also update the documentation to reflect the changes.
Thanks for the quick turnaround, Charlie Miller. I'll coordinate with the documentation team to get the updates done.
Perfect, thanks Charlie Taylor. Let me know if you need any more details from my side.
Hi team, the bug titled 'Unresponsive UI Elements During Data Drill-Down' has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/45.

The root cause was identified as inefficient event handling in the UI layer. It was struggling to manage multiple user interactions during intensive data operations, which led to the unresponsiveness.

To fix this, I optimized the event handling by implementing a debounce mechanism. This ensures that the UI processes events at a manageable rate, preventing overload during data drill-down operations.
Great work, @eid_b6268ef7! That should make a big difference for users who need to analyze data in detail.
Thanks, Charlie! I'll make sure to test this thoroughly in the next QA cycle. @eid_b6268ef7, did you also update the documentation to reflect these changes?
Yes, Ian, I updated the documentation to include the new event handling process. Let me know if you need any more details.
Thanks, Charlie. I'll inform the support team so they can update the users about the fix.
Hi team, the bug titled 'UI Freezes During High-Volume Data Visualization' has been resolved. You can check out the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/46.
The root cause was identified as inefficient rendering algorithms that struggled with large datasets. This caused the UI to become unresponsive.

To fix this, I optimized the rendering process by implementing a more efficient data chunking strategy and leveraging Web Workers to handle the rendering tasks asynchronously. This should prevent the UI from freezing even with large datasets.
Great work, @eid_d098d618! This was a critical issue for our users. Thanks for addressing it so quickly.
Nice job, Ian! I'll run some additional tests to ensure everything is working smoothly. Let me know if there's anything specific you'd like me to focus on.
Thanks, Alice and Charlie! @eid_b6268ef7, please focus on testing with the largest datasets we have to ensure the fix holds up under maximum load.
Will do, Ian. I'll get started on that right away.
Once Charlie confirms the tests, we can update the release notes and inform the users about the fix. Thanks again, Ian!
Sounds good, Alice. Looking forward to the test results. Thanks, everyone!

Hi team, the bug titled 'Latency Reduction Feature Causes Increased API Response Time' has been resolved. You can check the details in the approved PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/47.
Great news, Ian! Can you explain what was causing the issue?
Sure, Alice. The root cause was a misconfiguration in the optimization parameters. This led to suboptimal routing of API requests, which ironically increased the response time instead of reducing it.
Thanks for the update, Ian. How did you manage to fix it?

To resolve it, I adjusted the optimization parameters to ensure that the routing logic prioritizes the shortest path for API requests. I also added a validation step to catch any similar misconfigurations in the future.
Sounds like a solid fix, Ian. Thanks for jumping on this so quickly!
Agreed, nice work! Let us know if there's anything else we need to test on our end.
Thanks, Charlie and Alice. I'll keep you posted if anything else comes up. For now, everything should be back to normal.
Hi team, several customers are reporting issues with FlowForce that need our attention. Let's go through them one by one. üòä

First up, we have an issue titled 'Incorrect Data Aggregation in Summary Views'. The summary views in the FlowForce dashboard are displaying incorrect aggregated data. This is impacting the User Interface & Data Visualization Module and causing frustration for Customer CUST-0018. @eid_d098d618, this one's for you.
Got it! I'll start looking into the data aggregation issue right away. Thanks for the heads-up! üëç

Great, thanks! Next, we have 'Delayed Data Refresh in Real-Time Dashboards'. The real-time dashboards aren't updating promptly, which is also affecting the User Interface & Data Visualization Module. This is causing issues for Customer CUST-0007. @eid_d0d918f1, can you take this one?
Sure thing! I'll dive into the real-time dashboard refresh issue and see what's causing the delay. üöÄ

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, we have 'Data Loss During High-Volume Transactions'. Some API flow data is being lost during synchronization under high transaction volumes. This affects the Database & Data Synchronization Module and is impacting Customer CUST-0038. @eid_d098d618, this one's also for you.
Understood, I'll handle the data loss issue as well. I'll make sure to prioritize both tasks and keep everyone updated. üí™
Thanks, everyone! Let's make sure to keep the customers updated on our progress. Feel free to reach out if you need any help or additional resources. Let's get these issues resolved! üôå

Thanks, Alice! This Grafana issue does seem quite similar to what we're seeing. I'll review the PR to see how they approached the fix. It might give us some ideas on how to tackle our data aggregation problem. üëç

Great! Next up is a bug in Kibana titled 'Delayed Data Refresh in Visualizations'. This aligns with our 'Delayed Data Refresh in Real-Time Dashboards' issue. Check out the PR here: https://github.com/elastic/kibana/pull/1538. Charlie, could you take a look and see if there's anything we can learn from their approach?
Sure thing, Alice! I'll dive into the Kibana PR and see how they handled the refresh delays. Hopefully, it will shed some light on our dashboard refresh issue. üöÄ

Awesome, thanks! Lastly, there's a PostgreSQL bug titled 'Data Loss During High-Volume Transactions'. This is quite similar to our 'Data Loss During High-Volume Transactions' issue. Here's the PR link: https://github.com/postgres/postgres/pull/1539. Ian, since you're already looking into our data loss issue, could you also review this one?

Thanks, Ian and Charlie! Let's keep these open-source solutions in mind as we work on our fixes. Feel free to reach out if you need any help or want to discuss further. Let's get these issues resolved! üôå

Hi team, the bug titled 'Delayed Data Refresh in Real-Time Dashboards' has been resolved. You can check out the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/48.

The root cause was a bottleneck in the data synchronization process between the API flow optimizer and the visualization module. It wasn't optimized for real-time data streams, which led to the delays.
To fix this, I optimized the data synchronization by implementing a more efficient queuing mechanism that prioritizes real-time data updates. This should ensure that the dashboards refresh promptly.
Great work, Charlie! Thanks for tackling this so quickly. I'll test it out and make sure everything is running smoothly.
Thanks, @eid_d0d918f1! This was a critical issue for our users. Let me know if you need any help with further testing or monitoring.
Thanks, Alice and Ian! Your support is appreciated. Let me know if you encounter any issues during testing.
Hi team, the bug titled 'Data Loss During High-Volume Transactions' has been resolved. You can check the details in the PR here: https://github.com/salesforce/FlowForce/pull/49.
The root cause was identified as the database's transaction handling mechanism, which was failing to manage high concurrency levels, leading to dropped transactions.

To fix this, we implemented a more robust transaction management strategy by optimizing the locking mechanism and increasing the transaction buffer size. This ensures that transactions are queued and processed efficiently even under high load.
Great work, Ian! Thanks for resolving this so quickly. This should really help with the data integrity issues we've been seeing.
Thanks, @eid_d098d618! I'll run some tests on our end to ensure everything is stable now.
Thanks, Charlie. Let me know if you encounter any issues during testing.
I'll also update the documentation to reflect these changes. Thanks again, Ian!
Sounds good, Alice. Appreciate the help!
